newsitem.title: DUBAI: Dubai air cargo traffic normal after Indian strike.
newsitem.headline: Dubai air cargo traffic normal after Indian strike.

text.p: An Indian air traffic controllers' strike on April 11 and 12 had some negative impact on Dubai air cargo operations, said the operations manager of a large Dubai forwarder.
"But as the strike was so short-lived, we have already caught up," he said.
The strike was called off around 1130 GMT on Saturday.

"We made contingency plans by speeding up clearance and delivery to customers in Dubai so the wait was cut. The main impact was on goods coming from the Far East with routings over India, which were delayed," said the forwarder.
He added that the airfreight problems which were experienced concerned machinery and car spare parts destined for Dubai.

"Our problem was that we did not get any space on the European sector," said the export manager at another Dubai forwarder, adding that the cargo was booked on carriers transiting at Dubai from the Far East.
"We had around 25 tonnes which had to wait in the warehouse for two days before we made alternative plans and put it on another carrier to Europe," he said.
